questions.question_text: Which statement about RIPv2 is true?

discussion.content:
The answer should be D.

Explanation:

- By default, all interfaces are NOT passive (in term of RIPv2).
- Auto-summary is enabled by default.
- RIPv2 is a classless routing protocol.
- The syntax of RIPv2 is:
==>> router rip
==>> version 2
That means: enable RIP routing protocol first, then enable version 2 of RIP (RIPv2).

choices.D: The RIP routing protocol must be enabled on the router before RIPv2 is configured.
choices.B: It is a classful routing protocol.
choices.C: Auto summary is disabled by default.
choices.A: Unless the network command is issued under the routing process, all interfaces are passive by default.

discussion.content:
I agree with eri that the answer should be D(255.255.255.255)

Explanation:

A wild card mask is a matching rule. The rule for a wildcard mask is:

0 means that the equivalent BIT must match
1 means that the equivalent BIT does not matter

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wildcard_mask
0 in wildcard mask means "match" all bits, and 255 means all 1-s so it doesn't care. I thing any is 255.255.255.255

questions.question_text: Which wildcard mask is equivalent to "any"?

discussion.content: I was thinking the answer will ne C

questions.question_text: Which tool can you use to view each Layer 3 hop along the path to a destination?

discussion.content: Actually answer is D, it ask for metric not administrative distance, in this case AD/metric, so metric is the last one

Answer is B.
D - EIGRP = Administrative Distance of 90
